page.title: 18Shopping Survey - Background
page.content: Apart from the Sub-Post Office, which is not a general stores, there is no shop in Garway. There was one in the past, and people did not often travel elsewhere to shop, but today it is almost essential to have a car and a freezer if you live in Garway. Hereford is 12 miles north of the village; Monmouth is 7.5 miles SE, Ross-on-Wye is 10 miles E, and Abergavenny 11 miles SW. There are village stores at Skenfrith (2.5 miles) and St. Weonards (3 miles). Our survey asked people where they went shopping, and how often. We asked specifically about the four named towns, and people also mentioned the following, all of which are within about an hour's car journey: Newport, Cardiff, Cwmbran, Bristol, Gloucester, Cheltenham, Worcester, Leominster.
